sen.j: 埿部視枳（はつかしべのしき、生没年不明）は、日本の飛鳥時代の人物である。
sen.e: HATSUKASHIBE no Shiki is a person who lived in the Asuka Period, although his birth and death dates are not known.
HATSUKASHIBE no Shiki is a person who lived during Japan's Asuka Period, although his birth and death dates are not known.
sen.cmt: 他ファイルのネイティブチェックを参考に修正しました。
sen.e: HATSUKASHIBE no Shiki is a person who lived during Japan's Asuka Period, although his birth and death dates are not known.

sen.j: はつかしべの「埿」（はつかし）は「泥」と「土」を縦に並べた字である。
sen.e: In kanji, his family name, Hatsukashi, is a combination of mud and clay, with clay placed under mud.
A kanji character in his family name, 埿 (hatsukashi) is a combination of 泥 (mud) and 土 (clay), with clay placed under mud.
sen.cmt: ここは漢字を残したほうがわかりやすいと思います。
sen.e: A kanji character in his family name, 埿 (hatsukashi) is a combination of 泥 (mud) and 土 (clay), with clay placed under mud.

sen.j: しきの「視」（し）は実際には、偏を「目」、つくりを「氏」の下に横棒一本を引いた「氐」とする字で、視の異体字である。
sen.e: In kanji, the first character of his first name is a variant character, consisting of a left-side component which means "eye," and a right-side component meaning "family," with a vertical line added below.
A kanji for the first character of his first name is in fact a variant character of 視, consisting of a left-side component 目 and a right-side component 氐, a character with a line added below 氏.
sen.cmt: ここは漢字を残したほうがわかりやすいと思います。
sen.e: A kanji for the first character of his first name is in fact a variant character of 視, consisting of a left-side component 目 and a right-side component 氐, a character with a line added below 氏.

sen.j: 672年の壬申の乱で大海人皇子（天武天皇）側につき、大津皇子の脱出行に同行した。
sen.e: During the Jinshin War in 672, Hatsukashibe took side of Oama no Miko (Prince Oama, who later became Emperor Tenmu), and accompanied Prince Otsu's escape journey.
During the Jinshin War of 672, Hatsukashibe took side of Oama no Miko (Prince Oama, who later became Emperor Tenmu), and accompanied in Prince Otsu's escape.
sen.cmt: 他ファイルのネイティブチェックを参考に修正しました。
sen.e: During the Jinshin War of 672, Hatsukashibe took side of Oama no Miko (Prince Oama, who later became Emperor Tenmu), and accompanied in Prince Otsu's escape.

sen.j: 埿部（はつかしべ）の埿は、「泥土」とも書き、泥土を材料に製作することをいう。
sen.e: In kanji, his family name, Hatsukashi, is also written in two characters, each meaning mud and clay, and together, Hatsukashi means to produce something using mud and clay.
A kanji character in his family name 埿 (hatsukashi) is also written as 泥土 meaning mud and clay, and together, Hatsukashi means to produce something using mud and clay.
sen.cmt: ここは漢字を残したほうがわかりやすいと思います。
sen.e: A kanji character in his family name 埿 (hatsukashi) is also written as 泥土 meaning mud and clay, and together, Hatsukashi means to produce something using mud and clay.

sen.j: 平安時代には山城国と摂津国に羽束（はつかし）郷があったが、埿部視枳の出身は不明である。
sen.e: In the Heian era, there were villages named Hatsukashi in the Provinces of Yamashiro and Settsu, but it is not clear whether Hatsukashi was born in either of these or not.
In the Heian period, there were villages named Hatsukashi in the Provinces of Yamashiro and Settsu, but it is not clear whether HATSUKASHIBE no Shiki was born in either of these or not.
sen.cmt: eraをperiodに、HatsukashiをHATSUKASHIBE no Shiki に訂正しました。
sen.e: In the Heian period, there were villages named Hatsukashi in the Provinces of Yamashiro and Settsu, but it is not clear whether HATSUKASHIBE no Shiki was born in either of these or not.

sen.j: 壬申の乱の勃発時、埿部視枳は近江宮がある大津市にいたらしい。
sen.e: When the Jinshin War broke out, Hatsukashi was believed to be in Otsu city where Omi no miya was located.
When the Jinshin War broke out, HATSUKASHIBE no Shiki was believed to be in Otsu where Omi no miya was located.
sen.cmt: HatsukashiをHATSUKASHIBE no Shiki に訂正しました。リンク表記で「大津市」となっていますが当時は「大津」なので（web表記も「大津」）、Cityは削除しました。
sen.e: When the Jinshin War broke out, HATSUKASHIBE no Shiki was believed to be in Otsu where Omi no miya was located.

sen.j: 大海人皇子が挙兵を決めたとき、その子高市皇子と大津皇子は敵の本拠である大津を脱し、二手に分かれて父のあとを追った。
sen.e: When Oama no Miko (Prince Oama) decided to raise an army, his two sons, Takechi no Miko (Prince Takechi) and Prince Otsu, left Otsu where their enemy had a headquarter, and followed their father, each taking a different route.

When Oama no Miko (Prince Oama) decided to raise an army, his two sons, Takechi no Miko (Prince Takechi) and Prince Otsu, left Otsu where their enemy had a headquarters, and followed their father, each taking a different route.

When Oama no Miko (Prince Oama) decided to raise an army, his two sons, Takechi no Miko (Prince Takechi) and Prince Otsu, left Otsu where their enemy had a headquarters, and followed their father, each taking a different route.

sen.j: このうち大津皇子の一行は25日深夜に伊勢国の鈴鹿関に到達し、翌朝朝明郡の迹太川の辺で合流を果たした。
sen.e: Of the two parties, Prince Otsu arrived at the Suzuka barrier in the Ise Province around midnight on the 25th, and joined the other party by the Too River in Asake-no-kori.
sen.cmt: 25日が何月かが明記されていませんので、日付のみ訳しました。
sen.e: Of the two parties, Prince Otsu arrived at the Suzuka-no-seki Checkpoint in the Ise Province around midnight on the 25th, and joined the other party by the Too-gawa River in Asake-no-kori.
sen.cmt: 鈴鹿関の訳語は用語集に従いました。Too RiverもToo-gawa Riverに修正しました。
sen.e: Of the two parties, Prince Otsu arrived at the Suzuka-no-seki Checkpoint in the Ise Province around midnight on the 25th, and joined the other party by the Too-gawa River in Asake-no-kori.

sen.j: 埿部視枳はこの一行の中にいた。
sen.e: Hatsukashibe was a member of the Prince Otsu party.
Hatsukashibe was a member of the Prince Otsu party.
Hatsukashibe was a member of the Prince Otsu party.

sen.j: ともに朝明郡にたどりついたのは、大分恵尺、難波三綱、駒田忍人、山辺安摩呂、小墾田猪手、大分稚臣、根金身、漆部友背であった。
sen.e: Other members who arrived in Asake-no-kori with Prince Otsu were OKIDA no Esaka, NANIWA no Mitsuna, KOMADA no Oshihito, YAMAHE no Yasumaro, OHARITA no Ite, OKIDA no Wakaomi, NE no Kanemi, and NURIBE no Tomose.

Other members who arrived in Asake-no-kori with Prince Otsu were OKIDA no Esaka, NANIWA no Mitsuna, KOMADA no Oshihito, YAMAHE no Yasumaro, OHARITA no Ite, OKIDA no Wakaomi, NE no Kanemi, and NURIBE no Tomose.

Other members who arrived in Asake-no-kori with Prince Otsu were OKIDA no Esaka, NANIWA no Mitsuna, KOMADA no Oshihito, YAMAHE no Yasumaro, OHARITA no Ite, OKIDA no Wakaomi, NE no Kanemi, and NURIBE no Tomose.

sen.j: この後の内戦で埿部視枳が果たした活動については記録がない。
sen.e: There are no records about achievements of HATSUKASHIBE no Shiki in the civil war afterwards.
There are no records about achievements of HATSUKASHIBE no Shiki in the civil war afterwards.
There are no records about achievements of HATSUKASHIBE no Shiki in the civil war afterwards.
